title: 820-00281 question, short on c3105
message:
I have a 820-00281 that had no 20v, only 5v from the charger and that was cycling.
No pp3v3_g3h but no short on that line.
Found short to ground on c3105
Removed u3100, now short on 3105 is gone and pp3v3_g3h is normal but still no 20v on any of the ports.
I am not familiar with how this board behaves and I do not have another donor board to check with.
Will any of the other ports get 20v with u3100 removed?
I have several u3100 on the way.

title: 820-00281 question, short on c3105
message:
You must change the chip, not just remove.
Be aware to use the same code termination.

title: 820-00281 question, short on c3105
message: Yeah have to replace the chip with another all 4 must be installed. Has to be same firmware

title: 820-00281 question, short on c3105
message:
Thanks for your reply.
What exactly do you mean by code termination? The last few digits after the part number?

title: 820-00281 question, short on c3105
message: Has anyone been successful in rewriting the firmware on these?

title: 820-00281 question, short on c3105
message:
Please write new post instead of comment.

No way to reprogram these chips.
You must use the same code; CD3215B03 will not work in place of CD3215C00, for example (nor viceversa).
